department: Public Works and Government Services Canada
short_summary: Construction of Wharf Structure at Lark Harbour, NL
full_summary:
# Notification of Invitation to Tender (ITT)

## Tender Details

- **Tender Title**: Wharf Construction at Lark Harbour, Newfoundland and Labrador
- **Reference Number**: WS4417993224-Doc4578375220
- **ITT Amendment Number**: 6
- **Solicitation Number**: WS4417993224

## Tender Accomplishement Status

- **Status**: Tenders are no longer acceptable. Although this Tender Notice has already been expired, any interested Canadian Businesses involved in the construction industry can review this tender to obtain valuable insights.

## Scope of Works

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) requires construction services for the construction of a new wharf structure at Lark Harbour, Newfoundland and Labrador. This project will involve the procurement and mobilization of construction equipment, skilled labor, and all necessary materials. Work Under this project is expected to commence within 115 weeks after the award of the contract is made.

**Estimated Value:** $5,000,001 to $20,000,000

**Classification:** Maritime Construction Services - *UNSPSC code: 72141200*

## Trade Agreements Relevant to Contract

This tender is subject to various trade agreements, including but not limited to the following:

- *Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)*
- *Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)*
- *Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)*
- *Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)*
- *Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)*

## Availability and Eligibility

Access to the tender location is open to all interested bidders. In order to be considered for this opportunity, you must:

*    be a Canadian business or foreign supplier authorized to operate in Canada (for non-Canadian businesses)
*    have the relevant experience, expertise, and equipment required to perform the scope of work

## Points of Contact

For any questions or clarification, contact:

*    Darling Adam Beaumaster 
*    PSPC
*    Adam.beaumaster@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
